title: First Astranis satellite sidelined by post-deployment glitch
summary: The first Astranis-built satellite won’t be able to provide commercial broadband over Alaska for local telco Pacific Dataport because it can’t keep solar arrays pointed at the sun, the Californian manufacturer’s CEO John Gedmark said July 20.

title: Louisiana Students to Hear from NASA Astronauts Aboard Space Station
summary: As part of the state’s first Earth-to-space call, students from Louisiana will have an opportunity soon to hear from NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

title: Amazon to build $120 million facility in Florida to prep Kuiper internet satellites for launch
summary: Amazon will invest $120 million to build a satellite processing facility at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida, as the company prepares to launch the first satellites for its Project Kuiper internet network, the tech giant announced Friday.

title: NASA emphasizes climate science role amid fiscal and partisan challenges
summary: In a summer of extreme weather events, NASA is emphasizing its role in studying the climate, efforts that face both fiscal headwinds and partisan divides.

title: Rocket Report: Space Force to pick three; Pythom strikes back
summary: "With this mission we’ve made big strides toward reusability."
